noun.description: A member of the highest Hindu caste, that of the priesthood.
(in Hinduism) the ultimate reality underlying all phenomena.
examples: Brahman is formless but is the birthplace of all forms in visible reality

noun.description: An ox of a humped breed originally domesticated in India that is tolerant of heat and drought and is now kept widely in tropical and warm-temperate countries.

origin: From Sanskrit brāhmaṇa ( Brahman (sense 1)), brahman ( Brahman (sense 2)).
